intro: Pleroma ledifolium, commonly known as the slender leaf pleroma, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky areas. Pleroma ledifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
